private_information: I arrive at Fisherman's Wharf at 09:00
I can travel between Fisherman's Wharf and Nob Hill in 11 minutes
I want to meet as many friends as possible today and prefer longer meetings when feasible
traveler.goal: Meet as many friends as possible today and ensure meeting Kenneth for at least 90 minutes during his availability window

private_information: I will be at Nob Hill from 14:15 to 19:45
I am available only during that window and can meet for at least 90 minutes within it
kenneth.goal: Meet the traveler for a minimum of 90 minutes sometime between 14:15 and 19:45

orchestrator.goal: Integrate reports from traveler and kenneth and produce a PDDL planning domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that optimizes the schedule to meet as many friends as possible while ensuring the minimum 90-minute meeting with Kenneth

public_information: Travel time from Fisherman's Wharf to Nob Hill is 11 minutes
Travel time from Nob Hill to Fisherman's Wharf is 11 minutes
You arrive at Fisherman's Wharf at 09:00
Kenneth will be at Nob Hill from 14:15 to 19:45
You would like to meet Kenneth for a minimum of 90 minutes

report.system_prompt: You are the traveler agent responsible for reporting your schedule constraints and preferences. Use the public information and your private information to produce a concise machine-readable report for the orchestrator.
report.prompt: Your name is traveler. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->traveler->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->traveler->goal}. Produce a concise report of your constraints, available time windows, travel times, and meeting priorities to feed the orchestrator.

report.system_prompt: You are the kenneth agent responsible for reporting your availability constraints. Provide a precise availability window and any meeting preferences for the orchestrator to use.
report.prompt: Your name is kenneth. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->kenneth->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->kenneth->goal}. Produce a concise report of your availability, earliest start, latest end, and minimum meeting duration for the orchestrator.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator agent. Integrate the reports from other agents and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that can be solved with the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL must represent separate actions for each agent when relevant, respect travel times, availability windows, and the constraint that Kenneth must be met for at least 90 minutes. The planning encoding should include an objective to maximize number of meetings and/or minimize travel time while satisfying the Kenneth 90-minute constraint. Target the FastDownwards solver and ensure the PDDL is compatible with it.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive structured reports from the traveler and kenneth: {traveler_report} and {kenneth_report}. Integrate these inputs, resolve any naming mismatches, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that encodes locations, travel times, agent presence windows, meeting durations, and an optimization metric to prefer schedules that meet more friends and respect the minimum 90-minute meeting with Kenneth. Keep actions for different agents distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
